alert.note: Alert for Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 08 at 2:48PM MST until September 08 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... northern Navajo County in north central Arizona... * Until 600 PM MST. * At 247 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain near Navajo National Monument. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Navajo National Monument and Tsegi. This includes the following highways... Highway 160 between mile markers 374 and 384. State Route 564 between mile markers 375 and 383. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Laguna Creek, Tsegi Canyon, Nokai Creek, Shonto Wash, Last End Wash and Parrish Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
